intro: Brachistus diversifolius, commonly known as the variable leaf brachistus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that vary in shape and size across different individuals, contributing to its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer months. Brachistus diversifolius is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
